course.subject: ENVR
course.name: Sustainability Thinking
course.description: This hands-on course is designed to develop skills in aspiring sustainability practitioners. Understanding sustainability requires a deep appreciation of the complexities of human behavior. This course will examine the kinds of influences on how people make decisions, react to certain incentives and inducements, and make sense of competing interests. Building on this understanding, students will learn to collect and analyze data relevant to sustainable behaviors, particularly within the context of green buildings. Finally, students will use the data to design a real-time intervention intended to shift behaviors in a more sustainable direction. Instructor consent is required.

reviews.author: IWTV
reviews.comment_content: There are 3 projects. All of them focus on how we can change people's behaviour by interventions. For example, project focused on shark fin issues, we are asked to investigate the reason why people consume shark fins and formulate actions to stop people from consuming shark fins.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof encourages discussions during class, so we exchange idea on different sustainability issues.
reviews.comment_grading: It was a small class, and the grading is great.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 3 projects throughout the course, so the workload is a little bit heavy. There are 2 short essays as well, focused on reviewing key concepts learned in class.
